Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2008 11:42AM lizws wrote: Susan, I haven't done cisplatin but highly recommend Emend for home nausea and Aloxi IV prior to infusion.  They used both on me during A/C and I was never sick.  I know that these ladies will have lots of info for you.  Lemon drops  and using plastic utensils may help with the metallic taste.  Can she eat/drink ice cream, shakes, Ensure? things like that.  Yogurt?  things that don't "smell".  As I said, they'll be plenty of better help come along. Liz

Posts.Title: Dx with Brain Mets Today TripleNeg snowyday

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2009 01:05PM lizws wrote: Hi JL, I'm sorry you are having so much pain.  I had bilateral masts with expander reconstruction.  I wish I could help you but am not sure what the "rope" feeling is.  Could this be a muscle that has been manipulated by the surgeries? I find it interesting also that your surgeon would suggest additional surgery for this.  I'll do some research also.  Also, have you tried sleeping in a recliner?  I did for a few months and it made a huge difference.  If no recliner, try a wedge pillow.  Your body can't heal without good sleep.   Have you tried corn starch since your deodorant isn't working?  I'm grasping at straws here...... Keep checking back as I'm sure others will respond.  Hang in there..... it does get better! Hugs,  Liz
